links.label: The Golden Age of Radio: Program 35 - February, 1973 - Don Ameche
The Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy Show: An Episode Guide and Brief History by Martin Grams, Jr.

infos.info: This style of marital strife as comedy continued into television, notably ';The Honeymooners'; and ';All in the Family.'

This is the only old-time radio series in which the principal characters spend most of their time in bed. John is a chronic snorer and Blanche is an insomniac. In many episodes, Blanche wakes John up with her complaining and he flies into a towering rage. That provides most of the humor. One of the best exchanges occurs when Blanche accuses John of not loving her. He reminds her that he just took out a life insurance policy naming her as beneficiary. Then she says 'You just did that to tease me. I know perfectly well you have no intention of dying.'
